How to Clean and Sanitize Household Electronics
During cold and flu season, keep home electronics like TV screens, cable boxes, DVRs, remotes, game controllers, sound systems and more not just looking and feeling clean, but also sanitized.
More from Clorox experts
Discover more ways to clean.
Use as directed.
Regular home cleaning typically focuses on floors, walls and furniture, but tackling home electronics is a more delicate matter. Luckily, there are a few products we can recommend for reducing dirt and germs on many of your devices. Just remember to always follow manufacturer instructions when cleaning electronic devices.

How to Clean and Disinfect Your Phone, Screen and Phone Case
How to sanitize home electronics
If you’re looking to kill germs on your electronics, spraying hard surfaces with
Clorox® Disinfecting Mist
is a great way to reduce germs. You don’t even have to wipe. Just spray, and walk away.
For more thorough cleaning and sanitizing of high-touch devices, you’ll be happy to know that the
Clorox® Disinfecting Wipes
you love can be used on most remote controls, game controllers and phones. Before you get started, check manufacturer instructions to confirm that bleach-free disinfecting wipes can be safely used on your device.

Steps to sanitize electronic devices with Disinfecting Mist
Power down the device
If your device uses an electrical outlet, make sure it’s turned off and unplugged.
Dust surfaces
Use the microfiber cloth to wipe away any dust prior to sanitizing with Clorox® Disinfecting Mist.
Spray on the mist
Hold the nozzle 6–8 inches away from the item and lightly spray the mist.
Tip
Surface should stay visibly wet for 30 seconds to sanitize.
Air dry
Let treated surfaces air dry completely before handling.
Steps to clean electronic devices with Disinfecting Wipes
Power down the device
If your device uses an electrical outlet, make sure it’s off and unplugged.
Tip
If obvious dirt is visible, pre-clean surface before sanitizing.
Wipe the device
Wipe down all hard, nonporous surfaces with a Clorox® Disinfecting Wipe, and be careful not to let any liquid seep into the buttons or other openings.
Tip
Surface should remain visibly wet for 10 seconds to sanitize.
Air dry
Let the surfaces air dry completely before use.
Frequently Asked Questions
How do you disinfect electronic devices?
To disinfect hard, nonporous surfaces, use enough Clorox® Disinfecting Wipes to keep high touch surfaces wet for 4 minutes, then allow to air dry. Always follow manufacturer's instructions for cleaning and disinfecting electronics.

An important safety message
Bleach and other disinfectants are not suitable for consumption or injection under any circumstances. People should always read the label for proper usage instructions. Disinfecting surfaces with bleach and the disinfecting products is one of the ways to help stop the spread of COVID-19, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Our products are safe when used as directed. It’s critical that everyone understands the facts in order to keep themselves safe and healthy.
